channel.title: Scrolls from the Dead Sea
channel.description:
The story of the Dead Sea Scrolls, featuring interviews with 30 leading scholars, scientists, archeologists and theologians.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: The word of God shall live together
item.description: The significance of the Scrolls to the study of the Old Testament and to Judaism.
item.dc:creator: Schmidt, Karl
item.dc:subject: Archaeological assemblages

item.title: The search for God in wilderness
item.description: This program focuses on the scroll entitled "The Manual of Discipline," which governed a pre-Christian ascetic sect.
item.dc:creator: Schmidt, Karl
item.dc:subject: Archaeological assemblages

item.title: Teacher of righteousness?
item.description: This program explores the controversy over the identity of the leader of the Qumran sect.
item.dc:creator: Schmidt, Karl
item.dc:subject: Archaeological assemblages

item.title: I shall praise thee, o Lord'
item.dc:creator: Schmidt, Karl
item.dc:subject: Archaeological assemblages

item.title: The incredible discovery
item.description: How a shepherd boy made the first discovery of the caves. The buying and selling of the Scrolls.
item.dc:creator: Mansoor, Menahem
item.dc:subject: Archaeological assemblages

item.title: The treasure trove
item.description: This program focuses on two particular scrolls which tell of buried treasure.
item.dc:creator: Schmidt, Karl
item.dc:subject: Hidden treasures

item.title: The missing Shapira manuscript
item.description: In 1883, a "Dead Sea" Deuteronomy Scroll sold by a Jerusalem antique dealer to the British Museum was declared a fraud. This program reexamines the case in light of the discovery of the Dead Sea Scrolls.
item.dc:creator: Mansoor, Menahem
item.dc:subject: Forgery of manuscripts

item.title: The flood of light
item.description: A cross-section of scholarly opinion on the significance and importance of the Scrolls, as well as the ways in which they are a gain for religion.
item.dc:creator: Schmidt, Karl
item.dc:subject: Archaeological assemblages

item.title: Parallels and contrasts
item.description: Who were the people related to the Dead Sea Scrolls?
item.dc:creator: Schmidt, Karl
item.dc:subject: Archaeological assemblages

item.title: The battle of the dating
item.description: This program describes how scholars arrived at the probable age of the Dead Sea Scrolls.
item.dc:creator: Mansoor, Menahem
item.dc:subject: Radiocarbon dating.

item.title: The crucial issue
item.description: This program offers views on the parallels between the Teacher of Righteousness, Christ, and the Messianic doctrine.
item.dc:creator: Schmidt, Karl
item.dc:subject: Archaeological assemblages

item.title: Sarah was exceedingly fair
item.description: Relevant excerpts from post-Biblical rabbinical literature and a particular focus on a scroll that details the beauty of Sarah.
item.dc:creator: Schmidt, Karl
item.dc:subject: Sarah (Biblical matriarch)

item.title: The fabulous library
item.description: The story of the excavation of the monastery of Qumran and further discoveries.
item.dc:creator: Mansoor, Menahem
item.dc:subject: Archaeological assemblages
